title: Château Saint-Maur 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From one of the old Provence estates, this is a concentrated herbal wine. It has plenty of spice as well as full red fruits and balanced acidity. This is a fine wine, packed with taste. Drink now.

title: Château Thuerry 2016 Les Abeillons Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This wine, named after a swarm of bees, comes from a small region in the center of the larger Côtes de Provence. From high-altitude vineyards in a state park, it is cool while keeping plenty of richness. The acidity and the red-currant fruits dominate this attractive, ready-to-drink wine.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2015 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tangy yellow grapefruit aromas meet broad Gala apple and almond scents in this bottling from veteran winemaker Norman Beko. The palate is light in texture but overflows with marshmallow, lemon and sea salt flavors.

title: Damiani 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)
description: While initially quite smoky and closed, time and aeration coax bright, cheery black plum and cherry flavors from this boldly structured wine. Its rich silky palate balances squarely against brisk acidity and firm gripping tannins that extend the finish. Subtleties of bramble and spice add elegance.

title: Damiani 2016 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)
description: Crunchy fresh pears and white grapefruit abound in this pert fruity Pinot Grigio. Despite its light body, it's expansive and silken on the palate, finishing on a crisp lemon-drop tone. Drink now through 2019 to maximize its fresh appeal.

title: Browne Family Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of toast, melon and butter lead to sleek stone and tropical fruit flavors that persist on the finish.

title: Caligiore 2014 Single Organic Vineyard Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of berry fruits, barrel spice and desert herbs lead to a solid palate that's tight as a fist. This tastes dry, spicy and oaky, with peppery berry and plum notes. An oaky spicy finish offers just enough bold plum and berry fruit.

title: Viña Otano 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: This shimmering barrel-fermented blend of 75% Viura and 25% Tempranillo Blanco opens with stable aromas of apple, butter and fresh corn. An elegant fairly light palate delivers a mix of dry oak, nectarine, peach and apple flavors. This is lithe and comfortable on the finish, with modest but noticeable residual oak.

title: Weixelbaum 2016 Strasser Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's nose is shy but fresh. The palate shows taut, tart fruit, with hints of red apple and citrus. This is very slender and light with a clean, dry finish.

title: Vinterra 2015 Pinot Noir (New Zealand)
description: This is gentle, supple Pinot Noir that's ready to drink. Subtle cola, herb and red-fruit shadings are varietally correct, picking up hints of cinnamon and then finishing tart and mouthwatering.

title: Waters 2013 Interlude Red (Washington)
description: Merlot makes up just over half of this wine, with Cabernet Sauvignon (39%) playing second fiddle and Cabernet Franc and Malbec rounding it out. It's expressive, with aromas of fig, golden raisins, eucalyptus and red fruit, with the aromas seeming slightly dried out. The palate is fruit forward and textured, while still showing restraint and length.

title: Testarossa 2015 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light, fresh and floral, this bottling from the Los Gatos single-vineyard specialists shows honeysuckle, Gravenstein apple, wet stone and marzipan scents on the nose. The palate is framed by vibrant acidity and a grippy texture, with caramelized apple as the predominant flavor.

title: Schiopetto 2015 Malvasia (Collio)
description: Orchard fruit and white spring flower aromas drift out of the glass. On the rounded palate, bitter almond accents ripe pear, yellow apple and white peach flavors.

title: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Rich texture and generous fruit flavors make this wine feel full bodied and mouth-filling. The aromas suggest lemon peel and lime juice, while the flavors veer more towards honeydew melon. All that fresh fruit lingers on the finish.

title: Pratsch 2016 Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine opens with red apple peel and citrus aromas that also play on the fresh, light and zippy palate, made livelier by slight spritz. It's dry, refreshing and light, with lots of red apple fruit.

title: Pepper Bridge 2014 Estate Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Dark raspberry, barrel spice and smoke aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency. Perhaps some time in the bottle will help them settle.

title: San Simeon 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: This is a new grape for the Riboli family's brand, and they've managed to present it with enticing and rounded nectarine and melon aromas. There is a grippy texture to the palate, which serves as a good foil for its tropical ripeness. A solid first effort.

title: Sansonina 2015 Fermentazione Spontanea  (Lugana)
description: This wild yeast-fermented wine has Spanish broom, honey, toasted nut and ripe yellow stone fruit aromas. The medium-bodied, linear palate mirrors the nose, doling out candied orange zest, dried apricot and mineral notes, with tangy acidity.

title: Winzer Krems 2016 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Green and yellow pear peel notes accent this wine's yeasty, savory nose. The palate has spritz and, rather than amplifying those pear notes, leads with lemony freshness. Lovely, light and dry, it almost bounces with freshness.

title: Zantho 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: The nose of this Grüner Veltliner suggests generously ripe peach. That ripeness is tempered on the palate, with green and yellow pear fruit and a streak of citrus zest. Lively herbal spice and pepperiness last through the refreshing finish.

title: Anthony Nappa 2015 Luminous Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Streaks of honey and bee pollen extend from nose to finish in this deft off-dry Riesling. Tart tangerine and grapefruit flavors are vital and crisp, but also spicy, earthy and a bit rustic. The finish is long and intensely citrusy.

title: Château Laulerie 2015 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)
description: The Dubard family has produced a fine and ripe wine. Perfumed and with tropical fruit flavors it is a rich wine, packed with fruit and also finely textured. It has weight, yellow fruits and fine acidity. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château Trians 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This is a ripe fruity wine. It has weight and richness as well as intense acidity that cuts the ripe berry flavors. This is a food friendly rosé, full of fruit, produced from organically grown grapes.

title: Crápula 2012 Basado en Hechos Reales Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Overtly smoky woody aromas sit on top of earthy berry scents on this muscular Monastrell. Grabby tannins and outsize acidity create rigidity and roughness, while this tastes of shrill black cherry and blackberry. Oak is always present, with char the final impression.

title: Basilisco 2013 Cruà  (Aglianico del Vulture)
description: This wine's spiced plum, underbrush and French oak aromas waft out of the glass. The linear, ethereal palate offers prune, dried cherry and star anise flavors, set against austere, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It closes on an espresso note.

title: Bründlmayer 2016 Langenloiser Zweigelt Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Faint red apple and lemon scents show on the nose of this wine. Its soft, easy palate, enlivened with slight spritz, shows the same appetizing, freshly-cut red apple fruit. Light-bodied, charming, easy and fresh.

title: Bründlmayer 2016 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Appetizing and fruity peardrop notes dominate the nose. The palate has a refreshing touch of green apple and light, easy fruitiness within a slender and dry frame. Lovely zestiness marks the finish.

title: South Mountain 2015 Rincon Point Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Made by the vine guru of Ventura County, Bruce Freeman, this bottling from a stunning coastal site shows plump red currant, tangy red plum skin and wet slate mineral scents. There's an Earl Grey tea touch to the palate, with lavender floral notes, peppery spice, dark red fruit and a bright acidity that persists into the finish.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Mozia Fondazione Whitaker Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Pear and honeydew melon aromas lift out of the glass. On the fresh, tangy palate, a saline vein of minerality underscores white peach, yellow apple and juicy citrus flavors.

title: Pazo San Mauro 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fresh stony apple and citrus aromas are composed. Following that lead, this feels focused and fresh. Flavors of stone fruits, citrus fruits and white pepper finish crisp but not real long or deep.
